website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and powerful are the features users look for in a stick vacuum. This model designed for hard floors gets high marks for both.
pros: The 10 amp motor provides suction power comparable to an upright in this model that still manages to be lightweight
The unit is designed without a brush roller, allowing it to glide across hardwood and other non-carpeted floors without getting snagged
cons: While no brush roller makes this model ideal for hard floors, it also means the vacuum may not perform as well on carpet

website_summaries.verdict: An excellent buy if you have hardwood floors. It's hard to beat the suction power and maneuverability for the price.
pros: At only 7 lb., it's extremely lightweight and portable
Powerful suction for a vacuum in this size and price range
cons: Weight distribution causes it to tip over when not in use
Some users have problems with vents blowing dust away from the vacuum

customer_reviews.title: Powerful stick vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty powerful little vacuum. I like it for my bare floors. It really cleans very well. But it is a little too powerful to vacuum my area rugs. It sucks them up, especially my bathroom mats. And it is a short little thing. I am not quite 4'10" tall and I hang on to the very end of the handle. I would think anyone taller would find it very uncomfortable. Also, because the "cup" part sits so low on the vacuum, you really can't get it under the edge of cabinets. I like the long cord and the power.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved this little guy. It's super easy to assemble! I was surprised when I turned it on how much power this little guy had! I used it in my bedroom to pick up behind my 2 year old who dropped crackers all over. It definitely picked up better than my last vaccum a Hoover. The Hoover was just clunky and literally couldn't really pick anything. The Dirt Development had one button, easy to empty out and actually picked up dirt. The Dirt devil does sound like my Hoover, but I'm ok with that. You get a great value for your money!
customer_reviews.author: fresh slate

customer_reviews.title: I think you will like this, give it a try.
customer_reviews.text: Works very good so far and is light. I waited over a month to post to see how it holds up. Least amount I ever paid but this is a winner! The price is even less now so I may order me another and 2 more to give away. I am older and have a very expensive Electrolux, Oreck and at least 2 more broom type cleaners. Now the first 2 mentioned work great but hard for me to get around. I have arthritis so I needed something light. This does it for me!! I think younger generation need to buy this for their aging parents.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse JamesTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Incredible little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum does it all! It's not advertised as such, but it handles rugs and carpet well. (I don't have any shag carpet, but I would guess this wouldn't work well on that.) Very strong suction for such a small vacuum; it sucks up almost as much dust (probably 95%) as my full-sized Bissell vacuum but costs (and weighs) 75% less than the Bissell! Very light and maneuverable, and it's easy to empty out. The only issue is fine dust particles build up quickly on the filter and holder, but I just shake it off outside and it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Good stick vacuum for the price, doesn't do very well with bigger bits
customer_reviews.text: This definitely has a lot of suction for an inexpensive vacuum. It does not do well at picking up any larger particles (for example, I have small critters and it won't pick up bits of bedding or hay very well). it does clean carpet impeccably - i was astonished at how much came out of carpet i thought was pretty clean. For a cheap stick vacuum, it's good, but if you need to get any bigger bits, you may want one that comes apart into a handheld as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna Burke

customer_reviews.title: Sucks my hardwood like nobody's business
customer_reviews.text: Most of people's gripes in the reviews are valid. It tips over easy. Feels kinda cheap. The cord should be longer. I wish it were wider but it probably wouldn't work as well. Despite not being perfect it works extremely well on hard floors. Oh yeah and it costs 1/30 of what a dyson does and performs just as well if not better. This little thing will suck in a dust bunny over a foot away. Best buy for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Juice Box

customer_reviews.title: #lifehack-- so light and cute your kids will fight over who gets to clean
customer_reviews.text: *opens Amazon box* *double checks orders to make sure husband didn't order the kid's Dirt Devil toy vacuum* *skeptically assembles it* *turns it on, hears the mighty roar of superior suction* *entire family fights over who gets to vacuum* hashtag Mom Lifehack Translation: this tiny vacuum looks a lot like a toy, but works like a champ. It fits perfectly in my cleaning cabinet and has powerful suction, cleans up my hardwood and tile floors like a dream. It's light and nimble enough that my 2 year old can and does push it around while I watch from my seat on the couch, patting myself on the back and high-fiving Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: isaryl

customer_reviews.title: It sucks up food crumbs
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this vacuum. We bought it after having wood plank tile floors put in our entire downstairs. I have two toddlers and my floor is always gross. I use this every day. It is powerful and light. The cord is long enough to do my entire kitchen without switching outlets. It sucks up food crumbs, dust, hair, and even cat litter in our laundry room. It will vacuum our short pile area rug but not carpet well. It makes me happy to vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole D

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately that wasn't my purpose
customer_reviews.text: If you expect to vacuum carpet with this it won't be very effective, no beater brush. Fortunately that wasn't my purpose. I use it in the cat's rumpus room to vacuum litter she tracks out of the little box and dirt she tracks in from outside. It has plenty of suction for that and does a great job. The floor is dimpled rubber mats. For my purpose, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Theatre Buff

customer_reviews.title: Too powerful?
customer_reviews.text: We like this a lot and it is very powerful but it has 2 drawbacks for our ease of use. 1-it falls over easily. There is no lock on the handle and it often just falls over when you stand it up in the corner. 2-it is very powerful for a small stick type vac and therefore it tries to snap to the side when you turn it on. It will actually spin out of your hand when you first turn it on if you are not careful. Otherwise, very useful and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy a New one...I wore the First One Out
customer_reviews.text: GREAT GREAT powerful Vacuum for Hard Wood/Tile Floors. Even use it on thin Area rugs. Dog hairs are no match for this vacuum...I bought this same vacuum a few years ago and wore the rollers out. If you clean the bin out frequently and replace the filter often, it should last you many years. Only reason I purchased a second is the rollers wore down and it became hard to push. The power in the 10 amp motor is beyond awesome...Research it, not many out there, so light weight...LOVE LOVE this vacuum!!!
customer_reviews.author: ceegee

customer_reviews.title: Can recommend purchasing!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today. I HAVE an upright and a canister, but, wanted something I could grab & plug in quickly. I have indoor/outdoor cats who drag in dirt & debris from outside. Gave the machine a quick try & it is SIMPLE to assemble, seems to have good suction. Others have noted that it is loud & yes, it is. However, being hearing impaired, that's not an issue for me. Based on my initial try-out, I am very satisfied. Didn't give it 5 stars until I have more extensive use of it, but, based on my quick try out, I suspect it really does deserve 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: 1776 Lady

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy to use
customer_reviews.text: This vac is painfully noisy and spreads dust everywhere. It so loud it hurts my ears and I asked my wife to shut it off for fear of both of us suffering hearing damage from the noise. I would return it if I could. I wont donate it to a charity, it is in my opinion unsafe to use.
customer_reviews.author: bobbyjoe

customer_reviews.title: Getting out the vacuum used to be a hassle...not anymore!
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports usually is my guide to purchase; but, after buying 2 vacuums they recommended (both ended up at Goodwill), I just got what 'looked' like it'd work. And it does! I've got all wood floors and 6 furred kids, so I don't have to explain the importance of this sucking...It's lightweight (so much so, I have to be careful not to crack the plastic.) And at 7 amps, it's strong. Not even all the big ones have that many amps. It's super easy to maneuver (even stands on it's own, which for a broom design is nice.) Emptying the good sized collection cup is just lifting over the garbage and pushing a button.
customer_reviews.author: PithyWoman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: I loved this vacuum. I will probably be ordering another one soon, because I gave this one away when I moved out of my apartment. Regretting it now. This vacuum works great on the wood floors and the dining and living room rugs. SOOOO easy to release of the trap, you press a button and the bottom falls out into the trash. Only reason I did not give this 5 stars is because if you do not pay attention to how the filter comes out it can be a real pain to get it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum sucks, and sucks, and sucks even more dirt off the floor.
customer_reviews.text: I was getting tired of Eureka cordless vacuums that seemed more disposable in nature. I have an outlet every few feet so why not get a corded vacuum for my solid surface floors. I am not at all disappointed! This thing will suck the stain out of a grout line it is so strong. I also have a tight Berber knit carpet and it does equally well in getting the Florida sand from the carpet. I did my homework and am not at all disappointed. It's very light, rolls nicely and has a turbine like and F22 Raptor.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic vacuum for a hard floor
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic vacuum for a hard floor. I got it for my mother who's floors are always covered in kitty litter and cat hair tumbleweeds. It actually sucks the cat hair from some distance - you can see the tumbleweeds getting agitated from several feet away and because it does not have a brush or actual agitator, they get sucked in instead of blowing away. It does an OK job on small patches of carpet too. The suction is very strong so exercise caution on throw rugs. It would be perfect if it was cordless.
customer_reviews.author: S. Marincic

customer_reviews.title: Worked for ONE cleaning, then the dirt cup filled up and will not go back.
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum leaves black tire marks on my floor that I can not get out! I cannot empty the dirt cup and get it back together again no matter how long I try. I may have a "lemon" but did not realize the problems until after the 30 day return window had closed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stick vacuum
customer_reviews.text: The suction on this thing is great. I use it mostly to quickly vacuum up my Labrador's hair. It will pull it from inches away from the vacuum head, no need to sweep over the hair. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is it's ability to stand upright. It isn't well balanced and falls over all the time if not leaning on something. The last one I had never fell over. It has a made in China look, but I'm not concerned with how it looks so that didn't impact the rating. I'm rating on performance only and it would be 5 stars if it had better stability to stand on its own.
customer_reviews.author: diyguy

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have been through 2 Vacuums to do a proper job on my hardwood floors, this is the only one that actually cleans well. Suction is powerful and cleans my floors very well, especially the tile in the bathrooms. I also have 3 throw rugs and this does really well with those as well. I have not bought or replaced the filter yet so I cant comment on that, only that this thing is a powerhouse for hard word floors and you cant beat that price. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JAOF

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is amazing - the best I've had for picking up solid mater such as cat litter. Because the blower vents to the front, however, it blows (cat) hair away rather than pick it up. Revise the design so that air blows to the rear and I'll give it a 10 star rating!
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Lipman

customer_reviews.title: This is the best vacuum ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vacuum ever. It works on my floors, carpet, rugs, sofa...pics up tons of dog hair and very easy to clean out. I would absolutely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: It was affordable
customer_reviews.text: This Dirt Devil works pretty good overall, the vacuum does tip over and fall to the floor easily once your done using it as it is not all that stable standing up, but if you stand it up against a wall or in a corner that helps and its pretty easy to empty the dust and dirt from the canister, and clean the filter. Overall this is a decent lightweight vacuum best for hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: c marvin

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding! No Tools to Assemble - YEA!
customer_reviews.text: Super duper easy to assemble, I had it together in five minutes (Note: I'm not mechanically inclined). No tools required at all. I bought this because my new home has more hardwood floors and area rugs than carpet. Whereas this does not have a beater bar for carpets, I clean very often and have no fear of my carpets suffering. The dust and particles on the floor are just pulled right into the unit. I am pleased with this, and the low price is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: NIS

customer_reviews.title: Worst vacuum cleaner I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum cleaner is unstable and is falling down when upright. When it falls down it always falls forward and presses the dirt container release button. The dirt spills all over the floor. The dirt container contains an extra perforated metal insert, which serves no purpose, except constant need for elaborate cleaning. This vacuum cleaner is also extremely noisy. Worst vacuum cleaner I ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great for me...
customer_reviews.text: I've got two cats, hardwood floors, and a few throw rugs in a couple places. This works great for dust bunnies/cat hair. For vacuuming up almost anything from the wood floor, and does an OK job on the throw rugs. I use an old fashioned Hoover vacuum with rotating beater bristles on it for a real job on the rugs.
customer_reviews.author: This Time I Mean It...

customer_reviews.title: Feels a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and thought it was a small vac for a entire household. It is only for wood floors. OK that was my mistake and I returned it. I love the 30-40 dollar vacs, I think they are good value and usually last as long as much more expensive models. I just did not like the cheap plastic feel and chunkiness of this model. No offense Dirt Devil, I have owned and do own their products for years. This model you might steer clear of, unless you only have very flat floors and never need a brush agitator (It doesn't have one). My 2 cents.
customer_reviews.author: LL Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Life changed!
customer_reviews.text: New dark laminate wood flooring and a white haired dog sent me on a search for an electric broom. After hours of research and reading reviews i had decided that every vacuum on the market must be terrible. I took a chance on this guy based on the powerful motor. CHANGED MY LIFE! It's a rock star and gets the job done! Even does my low pile rugs! I use it almost every day. I'm considering a second one for upstairs!
customer_reviews.author: scooby

customer_reviews.title: I'd have trouble finding a vacuum that could effectively clean and suck up dust and dirt particles on both hardwood and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous after reading so many reviews of other products that regardless of the vacuum I ordered, I'd have trouble finding a vacuum that could effectively clean and suck up dust and dirt particles on both hardwood and carpeted surfaces. I was skeptical that this product was worth the positive reviews it already had but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. This vacuum is AMAZING on all kinds of surfaces and not only does it effectively clean on varied surfaces, but it is also very compact, able to be easily disassembled and stored and is emptied very easily as well. No complications, just easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: E PLAUCHE

customer_reviews.title: POWER
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a small stick vac. It worked great for years. But I lost it in a breakup. So I figured I would get a new and improved cordless one. I'll show him, right? Nope. It was fine for about 2 minutes. Then started losing power rapidly. I couldn't do an entire room. This time I wanted power, and I got it in spades. This vac does blow things around the room like other reviewers stated. But I've found that if I start at the far edge of the room and work my way backwards, it takes care of that oddity. All in all, I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy build, waste hatches have tendency to pop open on their own.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap flimsy build, strong motor but only fair suction, has high clearance so can't get under a lot of furniture, and because of the positioning of the bottom waste latch, it's easy to spring the hatch open by banging into low clearances. Also, the whole waste assembly occasionally pops out all by itself (see picture). You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Paniculture

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit for laminate floors for the price.Does a good job,noticed shiner floors it get the dust and cleans The seams of the flooring. I found it best to read the instructions carefully, and then get fimiliar with how to assemble the canister, this I know will make it easier to use each time.A great buy .Over all I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mikertv

customer_reviews.title: Works great on our tile floors
customer_reviews.text: Works great on our tile floors. Picks up everything even kitty litter. Even works well on low pile rugs, doesn't pull the rug up but picks up the debris. We did try it on a shag rug, and as anticipated it didn't work, but that's ok. For the price you can't beat it at all. We ordered and returned a higher priced model that didn't work well at all. We looked at tons of similar products and reviews. So glad we got this one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Scott

customer_reviews.title: ergonomically flawed
customer_reviews.text: the superseded cannister type more to my liking. this one requires bending over to turn on and off which is hard on the back. on/off should be closer to top of handle. this is not progress. but capitalism at its best bought it because I could not get parts for my old cannister.
customer_reviews.author: howard d

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. Yes, it's loud, but that's because it'll suck up everything in its path! I love how it maneuvers easily. It can stand up on its own (and won't fall over!), it's very light-weight, and it's easy to clean out the container. Definitely worth purchasing if you have tiled or wooden floors. Also, assembling it took just a couple of minutes. still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Faber

customer_reviews.title: This product was a complete disappointment. In fact prior to purchasing this product I ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was a complete disappointment. In fact prior to purchasing this product I read the reviews which rated this product a 4 1/2 stars. How can this be! When turned on the sweeper actually blows away the dust, so you are never able to suction up the dust. Exceptionally poor design. In fact, I will ALWAYS question reviews of products, and never use that as a measure to purchase a product.
customer_reviews.author: A Smistad

customer_reviews.title: It is horribly unbalanced so it falls over every other second
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is a joke. There are a number of reasons it isn't worth wasting your time with. First, the opening on the bottom where the dirt actually goes in is only 4 inches wide. If you have anything larger than a bathroom to vacuum it takes forever. It is horribly unbalanced so it falls over every other second. It's loud and supposedly has amazing suction. I did not find this to be true. I wanted it to vacuum our porch and it wouldn't pick up the larger bugs. I know it's not expensive but I wouldn't waste the money.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Nice $40 Stick Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I use this Dirt Devil Stick Vacuum in my bedroom which has laminate flooring and in my bathroom which has vinyl flooring. This stick vacuum works excellent in both rooms. The cord is plenty long enough and as far as noise level, it does make some noise but then again it is a $40 stick vacuum. My only issue with the vacuum is the head does not lock so the vacuum will not stand up on it’s own it needs to be leaned against something to stand it up.
customer_reviews.author: Clay R Burton

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this. We all ask ourselves "what if I want to pick up a bowling ball with the vacuum? What will my friends say if I tell them I pay under $25 for my vacuums?". Who cares??!! Dirt Devil keeps on making these "too good to be true" small, economical vacuums that actually ARE GOOD. This is our second unit; we have the cheaper ($14) for our bedrooms. This larger unit stays downstairs for the living room. We love them. They really vacuum; we have kids and these work.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pelotas

customer_reviews.title: Great, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this vacuum for year and a half now. I think it does a great job with dust, dropped food, and other dirt in my apartment. I find it works well on hard floors and on small rugs. A couple things to note. 1) This vacuum is LOUD. 2) This vacuum is not well-balanced. I find it is very easy to knock it over, which gets annoying sometimes. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase. I do not have any pets, so I can't comment on its ability to suck up pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for our entire upstairs
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our entire upstairs, which is all laminate flooring. It does blow out the front, so dust and pet hair blows around a bit. On the other hand, that makes cleaning corners easier as the dust is blown away from the edges. The only downside is the filtration - quite a bit of debris gets past the filter, which requires disassembling the canister to clean it out. Otherwise, quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: best stick vac and an incredible value for $39.I may buy another for the basement level.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable. We just moved into a new house with all dark hardwood and 2 yellow labs, need I say more? This vacuum is truly amazing, never seen such pickup and suction in a super stick vac. It pulls dog hair from the floor 4" away from the head. Incredible suction.and does excellent for a quick carpet vacuum ( not for deep cleaning). Love the bagless dirt cup, easy to empty. Only possible drawback is that it is somewhat unstable if left standing on its own.feels heavy and well made. My go to vac around the house.
customer_reviews.author: bocajoe@comcast.net

customer_reviews.title: This thing really is awesome. The reviews said I wouldn't believe the suck ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing really is awesome. The reviews said I wouldn't believe the suck and they are right! It so small but so great -- We have hardwood floors through the whole house and this thing has changed the way I clean. I really can't believe the power it has for being so petite! The cord is plenty long enough, the canister empties easily. and so affordable! I'm buying another one to keep in my parent's camper. I just love this thing
customer_reviews.author: SM911

customer_reviews.title: Great for tile floors
customer_reviews.text: One pass in a small room and I couldn't believe all the dust and hair I didn't even see on my floors will include a photo and I swear it was one pass in a not very big room. Well done dirt devil
customer_reviews.author: summer2013

customer_reviews.title: Works on carpet too
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little vacuum. I know that it is meant for hardwood/hard surfaces, but I have used it very successfully on my carpet floors. I don't think it would work well on high shag carpet, but on low to normal it should be fine! My only concern is I feel like that the bottom can pop open pretty easily. Hopefully it's just user error on my part and it doesn't happen again!
customer_reviews.author: farrahm

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud, but it Works
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the loudest vacuum cleaner I have ever owned. It really hurts my ears sometimes. Otherwise, it does work on Berber carpet, wood, and tile flooring. I do not think this vacuum will be effective on plush carpets. It is easy to empty the canister and it has not plugged up even when picking up long hair.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ski

customer_reviews.title: Works great on hardwood floors, cat hair and litter.
customer_reviews.text: Small, light and super powerful! I love this little vacuum so much that I bought two, one for my kids’ house and one for mine. Both houses have cats and hard wood floors. As soon as you turn it on, the tumble weeds of cat hair come rolling to the powerful suction. It’s easy to empty out the dust container. And it works wonderfully in the litter areas. It’s also light enough to lift and vacuum the cat hair off the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Jorja Vornheder

customer_reviews.title: It's light and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: It's light and easy to handle, but I bought it for hardwood floors and I am not sure it would be good to use on them on an ongoing basis. I will stick to the hardwood floor broom I bought for that and will use this for spills and my carpets on the hardwoods. I would give it a 3.5 if that was an option. The price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Graf

customer_reviews.title: The perfect tool for laminate floors.
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful appliance! Sure it is light weight, but it’s very durable and a joy to use. The motor is very powerful and not nearly as noisy as our other vacuums. For my money, it is the perfect tool for laminate floors. We plan to buy another for our summer house.
customer_reviews.author: PetoskeyKendal

customer_reviews.title: Best hardwood vac I've found yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd time buying this. My first one lasted for 4/5 years. Amazing power. I recommend this version over any shark on the market. We've had sharks too. They just don't last like this one. It has a plug... At least I don't have to look at it charging all day. Use it and put it away. I recommend this to anyone with a hard floor to clean. No brushes so it's safe for hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: big red

customer_reviews.title: WON'T STAY TOGETHER
customer_reviews.text: This thing keeps coming apart. The receptacle falls off. I kept thinking that I was doing something wrong. I've had so many others try it out that I have been accused of having them do my vacuuming. I need something compact. The suction is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C

customer_reviews.title: the best vacuum I will probably ever own
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, the best vacuum I will probably ever own. The first time I turned it on it about leaped out of my hand due to all its power. I was looking for a decent vacuum for laminate flooring that would not scratch it as well as could pick up hair without it getting caught in a wheel. This thing has so much power, gets the job done, and is effortless to clean. I hope it continues to last. When I think of best bang for the buck for a product I've purchased I never thought it would randomly be a vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Joke of a Vacuum,buy one and you will see for yourself.
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen a Vacuum designed like this one before, you turn it on and it blows the exhaust air down on the floor blowing everything away from the power head. If you want to use it on hardwood floors forget it. If you don't believe me then buy one and you can laugh like I did when I tried to vacuum my hardwood floor. The design of this is a joke. There should be a recall on this model or call it a blower instead of a vacuum!!!!! The five star reviews I am seeing have to be on a different vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small vacuum that I could keep downstairs so I didn't have to lug our larger upright up and down stairs. We have hardwood floors downstairs with a few area rugs. This vacuum has super suction! The first time I turned it on it kind of jumped from the suction it had! Works perfectly for cleaning the rugs downstairs and on the hardwood. I don't know how well this would work on plusher rugs/carpets and its certainly not for every day use on carpets only. I would definitely recommend this for use on area rugs and hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Leagalese

customer_reviews.title: Makes cleaning easy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best spur of the moment purchase I have ever made. I have a dog and 2 cats. And a 3 year old. The amount of fur and crumbs around my house was insane. And swiffers were a joke. The broom just pushed it around. But this thing right here. You guys this little bottle thing right here. I just cleaned all my steps, my game room and all of my living, dining, kitchen areas. And it took less than 30 minutes. I didn't have to mess with those gross swiffers pads. And I didn't have to kill my back with a dust pan.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Am very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Dirt Devil Power Air Corded Bagless Stick Vacuum - SD20505. Am very happy with this, so far. Bought it because it is corded and has 10 amps of power. It is also bagless. Use it on my thick pile carpeting. It's amazing how much dirt this vacuum picks up. I couldn't find this particular model in local stores. Was glad Amazon sells it. Several years ago, I had a prior model of this vacuum, which was 12 amps. The 10 amp model is quieter (the 12 amp model was EXTREMELY LOUD) and, to me, the 10 amp model seems to pick up just as much dirt as the 12 amp one did.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly strong little vac!
customer_reviews.text: Great little vacuum - I use it on my hardwood floors to do a quick cleanup. I was shocked to see how powerful it was (when you turn it on, it actually "jumps"! We installed hardwood flooring, and had tons of fine sawdust all over the place when we were done. This little baby sucked it up, even between the boards. The collector cup is fairly small, so you need to dump it often if you have a big mess to clean up. but generally that's not the case. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Carol in PA

customer_reviews.title: Not for PETS!
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have a hairless pet, this thing is worthless. Had a Golden Retriever visit my house and thought it would be a great time to try it. Absolutely useless! I got out the broom and finished the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little dirt sucker
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little dirt sucker! It's kind of gross how well this machine works, you can see how much fine dirt it picks up in area you think is clean visually. It's light weight which makes it easy to carry around from room to room, and the telescopic handle is an awesome touch. The canister is easy to remove but given the find dirt that it picks up, I recommend covering it in a plastic trash bag or else be covered gross dust. It is loud, no getting around that.
customer_reviews.author: Sarita

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks...just like it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: My house is mostly hardwood floors and this has been a great addition to keep the floors clean. Terrific suction, lightweight, easy to use, easy to assemble. I may get one for each end of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Randee Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Love the power on this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love the power on this thing. I really wanted a beater bar but glad I went for the higher amps instead. It was reported to be loud but I didn't think it was any louder than what it to be expected. Wish it had attachments though. I use this in my trailer, mostly wood floors with carpet in the slide.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. ODOM

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Love it ! Literally put it together in under a minute. Lightweight, just as loud as any regular vacuum which doesn’t bother me. Perfect for sucking up kitty litter. Only used it a few times but will update if I come across any issues. Very happy with price and overall functionality of this vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: ... my second Dirt Devil and I am still very pleased with it with one exception
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Dirt Devil and I am still very pleased with it with one exception. I would have liked a longer cord my last one was much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Pat R.

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you have a messy toddler.
customer_reviews.text: I love this, It’s so light weight and will pick up anything! I have a toddler that is constantly spilling stuff like popcorn, ships, cereal, etc and this little vacuum picks it all up in a snap, and emptying it is a breeze and you band beat the price at $30
customer_reviews.author: Georgianna Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Dirt Devil has lots of suction power.
customer_reviews.text: Dirt Devil has lots of suction power but, a lot of the dust and dirt does come out of the vacuum while cleaning. We have sand here and it blow out of the top of the canister a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Alleyspazz

customer_reviews.title: Worthless vacuum
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. It fell apart the second time we used it. I would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for its size and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this Dirt Devil after reading that it could pick up sand and small gravel. Well, it can and I was pleased enough with its performance that I purchase a second one. The unit is very easy to clean and requires no bags - which is a big plus for me. Even the filter is easy to bang/shake for cleaning and can be washed with just soap and water if needed. The cord bracket is worth mentioning because the bottom hook has a clever swivel design enabling you to simply flip it up for deploying the cord and then flip it back down for rewinding. I'd say it's better on hard floors than rugs.
customer_reviews.author: robosolo

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. I live near the beach and have a sandy backyard and no matter how many times I sweep my floors, I always end up with piles of sand. This vacuums suction is amazing and really gets the job done quickly and efficiently. My only complaints are that because of its shape its quite hard to get into any tight space and it feels really flimsy. With its flaws, I'm still a happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great compact vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for college or small apartment. Doesn’t do the job of a full size vacuum but is definitely great for a few rooms with hardwood or low pile carpet. The price here can’t be beat, cheaper here than the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for pet hair on hard wood
customer_reviews.text: Pros: light weight great suction easy to assemble easy to dump debris stands on own for storage Con: vents out the front so it blows away what you're trying to suck up... not fantastic for pet hair
customer_reviews.author: arm_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Works great on hardwood floors for animal fur and small objects
customer_reviews.text: Works great on hardwood floors for animal fur and small objects, and in small apartments...overall "okay" on hardwood floors (e.g., misses some larger debris and you have to go DIRECTLY over the dirt for the vacuum to collect... Works great for small rugs! I rated 3 starts because I would not buy this product again. Instead, I would look for something with more suction, larger base, longer cord.
customer_reviews.author: April B.

customer_reviews.title: Good suction.
customer_reviews.text: It seems a bit cheaply made but that being said it worked well it's first time out. Good for hard floors and short carpet. Not meant for large areas, but fine for a small apartment. For the price I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick One

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother for quick clean ups after the grandkids. She loves it. She said it’s light weight and works great. Just what she asked for.
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: Easy and pretty effective.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. There are better ones out there but you pay an arm and a leg. This works for a quick zip around on your hardwood or laminate floors.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Allissa

customer_reviews.title: Good suction, design could be better
customer_reviews.text: This has fabulous suction, but it seems to fall over very easily when I leave it standing to, say, move the plug to another outlet. Also, the cup doesn't attach all that securely on the front of the unit, so that generally falls off when the unit falls over. Kinda frustrating, but it works great and was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: moskigirl

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Price, Great Power
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. Build quality is good for the price point. PRO (to me): Good suction but loud due to the high power. Superduty dust & hard floor vac Literally if you turn it on without holding it, it can jump out of your hands. Very happy with it. We will see how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only a couple of months!
customer_reviews.text: This unit stopped working after only a couple of months use in our rental. It was only used at the end of the week and wasn’t even used on a daily basis! I attempted to send back but it was too late. I’m having to purchase a new vacuum once again. It worked when you plugged it in and worked well for the first several uses but gave out. Very disappointed! I’m going with an entirely different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I really love this machine. It has more power than most stick vacuums & does great with picking up CAT hair, dust & sand. Cat Litter too. Very light weight. The filter can be washed & reused (I bought extras anyway). Due to its power it is pretty loud & doesn't have a hose attachment. But since it can suck up M&'s from a foot away, you don't really need a hose.
customer_reviews.author: K. Saiz

customer_reviews.title: compact powerful vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stick vac. My first stick vac was the swiffer vac. Don't waste your money on that one. It has as much power as kids toy. Then I upgraded to the cheapest dirt devil stick vac which was a big upgrade. Finally that one broke so I upgraded to this one. This vaccum is so powerful. It easily picks up hair, dust bunnies and crumbs from hardwood and tile floors. I also use it on a couple of area rugs and it performs decently. It is worth the price for sure. It is small enough to store in my small kitchen pantry.
customer_reviews.author: sparkysarah

customer_reviews.title: works well on the dog hair tumbleweeds :)
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful suction, the cord is long so I don't have to keep changing outlets. I have 3 pugs who shed a lot and this vacuum is just what I needed for my hard floors. The only downside is that when I try to vacuum small throw rugs it's actually too much suction, haha. Otherwise I'm pleased with my purchase and I think this will be well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great  value for the price, pretty powerful
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and I was pretty surprised when I used it. For the price, it's an excellent vaccum. It's small and compact so isn't great for larger areas, but for those lazy days where you don't feel like sweeping the floor, this is perfect because it works well on floors, rugs, and carpets. Also, it's quite powerful although it's a little loud.
customer_reviews.author: A.S

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I received this for Christmas and promptly ordered one for my daughter-in-law. We both have hardwood floors throughout and after using this, we now realize that dusting the floors with another product was not as effective as we thought. This has awesome suction and gets up the dust and dirt in the tiny gaps and along the baseboards (though there's nothing specifically designated as an edge cleaner), whereas the other method just pushed the dirt in. I don't know how long it will last as I use it almost daily but so far, so great.
customer_reviews.author: kathy from MI

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this vacuum for over 2 years and I still love it! We have 3 dogs and 3 kids....we couldn’t live without it! Yes, it does have a few problems, but they don’t matter because it does the job of cleaning so well! It’s a must-have!
customer_reviews.author: T. Beling

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, has a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, has a lot of power, and decent value for price and quality. A little bulky to use, a little heavier then other stick vacs. The directions should be much more clear on how to disassemble and reassemble the top of vac where the filter is and for more thorough removal of dirt.
customer_reviews.author: D. F. Wood

customer_reviews.title: It's also lightweight and very easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Make no mistake! This little guy is a powerhouse! It's also lightweight and very easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: My2cents

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasantly pleased with this vacuum. It is very light weight and has great suction. I bought this to use on our engineered hard wood floors and was worried about it scratching them because our normal vacuum can leave scratches. Well this vacuum didn't scratch the floors at all. So I'm very happy! If I had one complaint it would be that the cord could be a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: coom74chic

customer_reviews.title: Ok... powerful suction, but feels cheap and falls over all the time
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stand on it’s own well, if at all so be careful to avoid having it fall on you. Feels flimsy and cheap. Light with powerful suction, I might recommend spending more for better quality depending on your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Atom

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job at cleaning the floors
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job at cleaning the floors. VERY flimsy design; it falls on its own all the time and it's a matter of when, not if, the thing will break under its own weight after a fall. Makes me wonder: one of these at $40 a pop means it can break 10 times before it would be better to get a comparable Dyson. So far this is the better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C

customer_reviews.title: Meh. I’m still using my broom...
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. It’s not as light as you would thing. It’s made out of plastic. It does not pickup nearby things, you have to be directly over them. It’s very very loud. And it blows a lot of air in other people’s faces (away from you though)
customer_reviews.author: PabloTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This works well on my hardwood floors. The only two downsides are One: having to hold on tight to it when you start it. It jumps a little. And Two: it doesn't stand well on its own. Overall, I like it though.
customer_reviews.author: K. Frog

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Cheap feel, does the job well, and it sucks big-time.. :-) It has a very powerful suction! Way more than I would have expected. Perfect for quick cleanups
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out fast
customer_reviews.text: The motor and dirt container are so heavy this will rarely stand up without falling over. Motor burned out in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: sleepyberry

customer_reviews.title: I like my lighter dirt devil even though it's not as ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful but doesn't fit under low edges (under kitchen cabinets, dressers, etc...). I like my lighter dirt devil even though it's not as high of ampage (pretty sure that's not a word but ya catch my drift).
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: it is AMAZING. I never write product reviews and couldn't wait ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I had very low expectations of this product when I first received it. It snaps together in 3 pieces, and honestly looked a little flimsy. However, it is AMAZING. I never write product reviews and couldn't wait to tell everyone about this product. It has so much power/suction it will jump out of your hand when you turn it on. It works better than my Dyson! I use it for hardwood/laminate floors and tile and am loving it. It is bagless, so it is extremely easy to empty with no mess. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: It is a bit clunky and will fall over easily since the bottom is bulky and the weight distribution ...
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum does its job. It is a bit clunky and will fall over easily since the bottom is bulky and the weight distribution isn't perfect. For the price, it does what it is supposed to do. You can tell it is cheaply made, though.
customer_reviews.author: L. Infraglow

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for my wood studio and rugs!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few months and WOW this thing is powerful! I am thrilled with the cord length, and its very easy to manuver. It is easily powerful enough to clean up damp food scraps, hair, fluffies, even off my fluffy rugs. Absolutely would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: It has great power, very light
customer_reviews.text: It has great power, very light, and cleans very well on flat surfaces, but not as well on steps. It wobbles and it's 42" high.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Best little vacuum I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best little vacuum I've ever had. I bought this mainly for my trailer in hopes that it would handle the throw rugs I have in there. Not only does this little guy have a ton of sucking power it is my new best friend for sweeping up my bare floors. Not only does it do more and tougher jobs than I had hoped for it is very easy to clean out. It's not meant to replace your heavy duty vacuum for carpet but for everything else it's the bomb diggidy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish it came apart to do stairs. It's ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish it came apart to do stairs. It's not as powerful as some of the reviews state. I put little felt 'bumpers' on the bottom so it won't scratch my hardwood floors. OK on dust bunnies but it won't pick up spilled kitty litter or gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Removes cat hair from the rug
customer_reviews.text: Yayyyyyy. Finally a vacuum that removes cat hair from the carpet and rugs. We have 9 cats at home and needless to say that accumulates a lot of cat hair on the carpet and the beautiful area rugs. We wanted to give this vacuum a try based on the reviews. This works like a charm in pulling out dust and cat hair. We are extremely pleased with this purchase. I think the handle seems a little flimsy. But very good price. Given the price of this vacuum, I won't complain :-) Overall a great product that works amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: Sujesh

product_meta.title: Dirt Devil SD20505 Powe, 1-(Pack), Red
product_meta.description: Dirt Devil, 10a, power air stick vacuum, 20' cord, cyclonic filtration, bottom empty dirt cup, straight suction, lightweight design, no tools included, for replacement power stick filter use TV #524-902.
feature_bullets: Cyclonic Filtration - cut through messes with constant powerful suction
Weighs less than 7 Pounds- lightweight design enables it to maneuver easily from room to room
Bottom Empty Dirt Cup - dump the dirt with the touch of a bottom. Cyclonic Action : Single Cyclonic Air System. Dirt Path : Center Dirt Path
20 Foot Cord - vacuum a room without the hassle of moving to multiple power outlets
10 Amp Motor - cut through any mess with constant suction power

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,626 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
